content.en: Privacy-preserving algorithms: Researchers have explored various approaches to preserve privacy in algorithms like k-means clustering and data mining. These approaches include secure multi-party computation frameworks, geometrical data transformation, min-max normalization, and data perturbation techniques. Additionally, techniques such as microaggregation, differential privacy, and k-anonymity have been used to protect privacy in clustering algorithms. These findings highlight the importance of developing algorithms that can guarantee privacy while still maintaining the utility of the data.
content.da: Privatlivsbevarende algoritmer: Forskere har udforsket forskellige tilgange til at bevare privatlivets fred i algoritmer som k-means clustering og datamining. Disse tilgange inkluderer sikre multi-parti beregningsrammer, geometrisk datatransformation, min-max normalisering og datastøjningsteknikker. Derudover er teknikker som mikroaggregering, differentiel privatlivsbeskyttelse og k-anonymitet blevet anvendt til at beskytte privatlivet i clustering-algoritmer. Disse fund fremhæver vigtigheden af at udvikle algoritmer, der kan garantere privatlivets fred, samtidig med at datanytten opretholdes.
